Q: Identify the sequence of actions taken by the person to get down the tree.
A:
1.	The person first puts their left foot on the lower branch.
2.	Then, they put their right foot on the lower branch and let go with their hands.
3.	Next, they reach out, grab the tree with their right hand and hold on, while their feet support their weight.
4.	They then let go with their left hand
5.	Then they put their left hand on the branch above the first branch they touched. 
6.	They then push themselves up onto the higher branch using their left leg to climb higher. 
7.	They move their right hand higher, grasping the trunk of the tree.
8.	They move their right foot on the trunk of the tree above the lower branch.
9.	Then they bring up their left foot, standing on the trunk of the tree, next to their right foot.
10.	They let go with their right hand and move it to just below the left hand, holding onto the trunk of the tree. 
11.	They then reach up with their left hand to a higher branch and grab onto it. 
12.	They use this positioning to push themselves up and off of the trunk, so that they are standing on the higher branch.
13.	The last step is for them to place their right hand on the higher branch they are standing on, as they let go with their left hand, and they are then standing on the higher branch with both feet.
